I join the legions of people who are grieving the tragic loss of Dr. Paul Farmer. All of us owe him a debt that can only be paid by carrying on his mission.

Gleaming world class hospitals, and locally trained doctors, nurses, and community workers now exist in places once thought impossible. Paul was not only a great doctor but a tireless organizer, inspiring thousands of people to actively participate in his work.
A true visionary, Paul insisted that ALL people have a right to excellent health care, and he developed the systems to deliver it in places others had written off.
Most importantly, Paul is responsible for transforming the lives of millions and millions of poor and marginalized people around the world, bringing them health care, dignity and justice.

Our world has lost an irreplaceable hero today. Dr. Paul Farmer, founder and leader of Partners in Health, is gone at age 62 of a heart attack. He was a beloved and cherished friend of mine.
https://t.co/ttY4xPWQH7

Earlier this month, I introduced the Franchisee Freedom Act so that small business owners harmed by violations of the FTC‚Äôs Franchise Rule can recover from the harm done.

Tech companies in other countries have regulated or banned easy online sales of suicide products - why should the lives of¬† US consumers matter less? #SaferInternetDay #TakeThemDown

Experts say that for most people, suicidal thoughts will eventually pass. When a person is having suicidal thoughts, limiting fast access to methods by which to die can make the difference between life and death.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says that since 2009, suicide has increased by 45% among 15‚Äì24-year-olds.

I‚Äôm joining my colleague @RepSusanWild to call on @YouTube to take down deadly "How To Tie a Noose" videos to curtail the adolescent suicide crisis. They have a responsibility to our children and our families. #TakeThemDown https://t.co/SFwDhsgRTL

Today, on #SaferInternetDay, they must end their deceptive business practices that led to this tragedy.
https://t.co/mp4Pz0840L
.@amazon is responsible for these failures. Earlier this month, @cagoldberglaw sued Amazon to hold them accountable for the death of her client, Mikael Scott.

.@amazon has deleted reviews aimed at warning other customers about deadly products and has cropped warning labels out of product images. Their algorithms have even *recommended* related products used to die by suicide. #SaferInternetDay

Companies like @Google and @amazon have been repeatedly notified about deaths specific products and videos of theirs are causing. But they continue to act as though they‚Äôre untouchable and above the rules of the law and of morality.

With adolescent suicide rates on the rise, the tech industry is *still* putting profits over lives.
¬†
@amazon and @YouTube have an obligation to take down dangerous products and videos that are used to die by suicide. #SaferInternetDay #TakeThemDown

Today‚Äôs prices are wayyyy higher than average prices in 1993 when #FMLA was passed. Although FMLA was groundbreaking, nearly 50%  can‚Äôt access FMLA benefits because leave without pay is simply unaffordable. We need a national #PaidLeave program that recognizes all families.

Over the past 29 years, workers used #FMLA over 300 million times to care and heal - for many, unpaid time resulted in financial instability that will affect generations to come. It‚Äôs time to level up and pass #PaidLeaveForAll. We‚Äôve earned it. https://t.co/x25lCe6tMj

We must pass voting rights legislation to save our democracy! Every person should be able to vote, and every vote should be counted. The spirit of the 15th Amendment was that the right to vote should "not be denied or abridged." Let's honor that. #VotingRights

152 years later, we are still fighting for voting rights for many disenfranchised Americans, including many Black and Latino Americans. For example, as a result of new restrictions passed in Texas, they have rejected 2,202 of the 32,817 applications for mail-in ballots submitted.

Today is the 152nd anniversary of the ratification of the 15th Amendment, which granted Black men the right the vote. Unfortunately, it gave way to Jim Crow laws & the birth of KKK, as previous slave owners now felt threatened by the Black men being elected to many public offices
This week marks 29 months of unjust arbitrary imprisonment of #Guapinol water defenders. They should be immediately freed and given reparations for the trauma and injustice they have endured!

Great news - more than 323,000 Illinoisans signed up for coverage on the marketplace during open enrollment! This is up from 291,000 in the previous year. Thanks to President Biden's American Rescue Plan ACA tax credits, more people than ever can access affordable health care.

Permanent #GlobalGagRule repeal was included in both the House and Senate FY22 #appropriations bills. We must act urgently to pass a final negotiated appropriations bill that includes this language. #EndGlobalGag

For four years, the #GlobalGagRule put lifesaving health services including #SRHR out of reach for people and communities who already had limited access to affordable, high-quality health care. Thank you @POTUS for taking swift action 1 year ago to begin repairing the damage.
